meanings.sent1: She tends to overstate her achievements to impress others.
meanings.sent2: It is not good to overstate your abilities when applying for a job.
meanings.sent3: He would overstate the size of the fish he caught just to make his friends laugh.
meanings.sent4: The politician's promises seemed to overstate what he could actually deliver.
meanings.sent5: The author's description of the magical land was so overstate that readers felt transported there.

meanings.sent1: The advertisement tried to overstate the benefits of the product.
meanings.sent2: It is important not to overstate the importance of one study's results.
meanings.sent3: The comedian would overstate his jokes to the point where they became unbelievable.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement over the new movie release could easily overstate its actual entertainment value.
meanings.sent5: The coach's praise for the player was so overstate that it made the team feel invincible.
